en.Blinking/fixed LED\nThe toggle button se:
Blinking/fixed LED
The toggle button selects if the LED blinks or stays turned on
en.The LED has three modes of operation: bl:
The LED has three modes of operation: blinking, turned on an turned off
SW2 pushbutton determines if the LED blinks/stays fixed
SW1 pushbutton determines the LED state (on or off), in fixed mode
en.A 4:1 mux from two 2:1 muxes\nThe LED ca:
A 4:1 mux from two 2:1 muxes
The LED can be in four states: off, blinking, on, blinking fast
en.4 bits shift register. It is loaded with:
4 bits shift register. It is loaded with the initial value 1000 and then
shifted on every clock pulse
en.Binary value to load and shift: Binary value to load and shift
en.Initializer. It has the initial value 0,:
Initializer. It has the initial value 0, so that the
i0 is selected in all the muxes. The register is loaded.
In the next cycle, it has the value 1, so the i1 input
is selected in all the muxes. The register is shifted.
In the next cycles it will remain in the shift state

An 8-bit binary counter, using an 8-bit bus splitted
into two 4-bit buses

Displaying the contents of an 16x8 rom memory in the LEDs
